It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which features a single pistil and reduced stamens, indicating a highly specialized reproductive strategy. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with small, lance-shaped leaves that are densely packed along its stem. Opulaster monogynus is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions, with a short growing season and a reliance on specific pollinators.
